poem:
Enigma of a Cyber Czar

The wrangling web of digital doings,
Changpeng Zhao cradles coin,
bathing in a binary bathhouse,
A laundering serenade from afar.
Endeavoring in ethereal economies,
Fell the might of Sam Bankman-Fried,
Distantly the gavel shudders.
Digital titans toppled,
Cryptic in their codes,
donned in digital drapery,
Injustice—or justice—comes binary.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Binance founder faces possible three-year jail term over ‘wild west’ business model Changpeng Zhao, the founder of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, will be sentenced on Tuesday after pleading guilty to money laundering charges, with US prosecutors seeking three years in prison for the tech tycoon. Zhao, 47, stepped down as chief executive of Binance in November after admitting to breaking US anti-money laundering laws. Last month, another fallen cryptocurrency mogul, Sam Bankman-Fried, whose FTX". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
